channel.title: How do i do this in VB 2005?
channel.description: Like when i press the RIGHT key something happens? I only see keypress keyup and keydown.. And how do i use the rightlclick method..

item.title: How do i do this in VB 2005?
item.dc:creator: @Flaming_Idiot Flaming Idiot
item.description:
@Flaming_Idiot wrote:

For key presses, you can handle them in the KeyDown event and for right clicks, you use the MouseClick event. Here are examples:

[code] ‘’’


‘’’ Code for handling right key presses.
‘’’
Private Sub KeyDownHandler(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs) _
Handles Me.KeyDown
If e.KeyValue = Keys.Right Then
’ Code Goes Here
MessageBox.Show(“Right arrow key pressed.”)
End If
End Sub

''' <summary>
''' Code for handling right clicks.
''' </summary>
Private Sub MouseClickHandler(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs) _
Handles Me.MouseClick
    If e.Button = Windows.Forms.MouseButtons.Right Then
        ' Code Goes Here
        MessageBox.Show("Right mouse button pressed.")
    End If
End Sub[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this in VB 2005?
